list_definition.definition: to clear (land) of water by the use of ditches and pipes

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There are plans to drain the marsh.
The water drained away/off into the ditch.

list_definition.definition: to pour off the water etc from or allow the water etc to run off from

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The blood drained from her face.

list_definition.definition: to use up completely (the money, strength etc of)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The effort drained all his energy.

list_definition.definition: something (a ditch, trench, waterpipe etc) designed to carry away water

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The heavy rain has caused several drains to overflow.

list_definition.definition: something which slowly exhausts a supply, especially of one’s money or strength

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His car is a constant drain on his money.

list_ex_of_english: Section from a lung lobe drained by banded veins.
